Soil map unit delineations were confirmed as accurate during a subsequent evaluation (1999). The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by extracting and formatting a subset of the Gridded Soil Survey Geographic (gSSURGO) Database for Federated States of Micronesia (2019) created by USDA-NRCS.
vectors.name: general land use

vectors.Description: The basic soil types of Kosrae. The original dataset was created by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) (1983) as part of the soil survey of the Islands of Kosrae, Federated States of Micronesia at 1:10,000 scale. Soil map unit delineations were confirmed as accurate during a subsequent evaluation (1999). The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by extracting and formatting a subset of the Gridded Soil Survey Geographic (gSSURGO) Database for Federated States of Micronesia (2019) created by USDA-NRCS.
vectors.name: Basic soil types

vectors.Description: The topography of Kosrae. It shows elevation contour lines at 50-meter intervals. Depicted in greyscale, the contour lines were derived by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) from a 10-meter resolution Digital Elevation Model (DEM) by U.S. Geological Survey based on topography compiled in 1967 and the shoreline dataset representing the zero contour line.
vectors.name: 50-m elevation contours

vectors.Description: The topography of Kosrae. It shows elevation contour lines at 10-meter intervals. Depicted in greyscale, the contour lines were derived by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) from a 10-meter resolution Digital Elevation Model (DEM) by U.S. Geological Survey based on topography compiled in 1967 and the shoreline dataset representing the zero contour line.
vectors.name: 10-m elevation contours

vectors.Description: The shoreline and the land area of Kosrae island, Lelu island, and smaller islands on the surrounding reef and in mangrove swamps. It actually contains two datasets: the shoreline itself and Kosrae base layer. Both were created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) based on Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) from U.S. Geological Survey 1:25,000-scale topographic maps. The shoreline and base layer were shifted and adjusted to follow current imagery better. In urban areas, the shoreline was updated using Worldview-2 satellite imagery from Digital Globe (2015-18) provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).
vectors.name: Shoreline

vectors.Description: Flow accumulation describes the amount of water in streams. The higher the value, the more water a particular location receives from areas uphill. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019). This was done by Maria Kottermair (iREi) through hydrological modeling using a 10-meter Digital Elevation Model (DEM) by U.S. Geological Survey based on topography compiled in 1967. Note that in very flat low-lying areas the data may indicate straight lines that are an artifact of the modeling process and do not reflect reality.
vectors.name: Flow accumulation

vectors.Description: It was generated by AutoGrid (2019), a web application that creates grids and map images from multibeam bathymetry data. AutoGrid is a program by the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA), National Centers for Environmental Information (NCEI, formerly NGDC). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) extracted a subset of the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas.
vectors.name: Bathymetry

vectors.Description: The topographic map, 1:25,000 scale, was first published by the U.S. Geological Survey (2001) as a paper document. The map was later scanned and georeferenced to create what is commonly referred to as Digital Raster Graphics (DRGs). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2020) converted the original PDF files to GeoTiffs. In the map shown here, portions of the DRG that fall outside the barrier reef of Kosrae are omitted.
vectors.name: USGS topographic map (2001)

vectors.Description: The steepness here is expressed in terms of percent rise and illustrated by means of a greyscale gradient. The dataset was derived by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) from a 10-meter resolution Digital Elevation Model (DEM) by U.S. Geological Survey based on topography compiled in 1967.
vectors.name: Slope (percent rise)

vectors.Description: The steepness here is expressed in degrees and illustrated by means of a color gradient. The dataset was derived by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) from a 10-meter resolution Digital Elevation Model (DEM) by U.S. Geological Survey based on topography compiled in 1967.
vectors.name: Slope (degrees)

vectors.Description: Slope aspect is the compass direction in which a particular slope faces. The dataset was derived by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) from a 10-meter resolution Digital Elevation Model (DEM) U.S. Geological Survey based on topography compiled in 1967.
vectors.name: Slope aspect

vectors.Description: The dataset was derived by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) from a 10-meter resolution Digital Elevation Model (DEM) by U.S. Geological Survey based on topography compiled in 1967. The dataset was derived using the so-called hillshade function that creates an illusion of viewing terrain in 3D.
vectors.name: Shaded relief (Hillshade)

vectors.Description: The dataset was derived by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) from a 10-meter resolution Digital Elevation Model (DEM) by U.S. Geological Survey based on topography compiled in 1967. The DEM was classified into elevation intervals and colored based on elevation in meters above sea level.
vectors.name: Elevation (Ranges & Intervals)

vectors.Description: The islets and buildings at Kosrae's premier prehistoric site, the ancient Saudeleur capital at Nan Madol. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by georeferencing and digitizing archaeological map [figure 8] from Cordy, R. 1993. The Lelu Stone Ruins (Kosrae, Micronesia): 1987-81 Historical and Archaeological Research. Honolulu: Social Science Research Institute, University of Hawai’i at Manoa.
vectors.name: Lelu ruins

vectors.Description: Some of the prominent prehistoric sites on Kosrae. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), using exclusively KML files created by Alex Zuccarelli for Kosrae Eco-Adventure Map Guide Series (2013).
vectors.name: Prominent prehistoric sites

vectors.Description: Ssome of the most significant cultural landmarks on Kosrae. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019), using Excel spreadsheet information provided by Kosrae Island Resource Management Authority (KIRMA).
vectors.name: Cultural landmarks

vectors.Description: The Areas of Biological Significance (ABS) on Kosrae. The dataset was created by The Nature Conservancy. A subset to show only Kosrae was created by the Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019). The polygons in the data are intended to capture those areas that represent the wide range of biodiversity features in the marine and terrestrial areas of FSM. They capture expert knowledge from the FSM Blueprint project. They are used to guide conservation planning and projects in FSM, and ultimately to help establish conservation areas.
vectors.name: Areas of biodiversity significance

vectors.Description: The designated protected areas on and around Kosrae. The dataset was created by the Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by merging information obtained from The Nature Conservancy and Kosrae Island Resource Management Authority (KIRMA). This GIS coverage may not be complete. Additional marine protected areas are referenced in legislation (e.g., http://www.fm/KosraeLeg/pending/PM_RD.doc) but may not have been delineated or formally implemented.
vectors.name: Protected areas

vectors.Description: The location of the principal quarry on Kosrae. Smaller quarries exist and are not shown. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) from KML file created by Joyminda Palokoa George (2019) specifically for this Digital Atlas.
vectors.name: Quarries

vectors.Description: The location of the landfills on Kosrae. The original data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) as part of the "Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia" project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) extracted a subset from the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas. The features were updated using feedback from Kosrae Island Resource Management Authority (KIRMA), which distinguished between the formal landfill and the closed sites.
vectors.name: Waste disposal

vectors.Description: The communication infrastructure on Kosrae. The features shown include communication towers, wifi access points, and cell sites. The original data, so-called Digital Line Graphs (DLSs), were created by U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) for the 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). The dataset was updated by Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) (2013) and Island Research & Education Initiative (2017) based on information provided by FSM Telecommunications Corporation, and by Island Research & Education Initiative (2019) using KML files created specifically for this Atlas by Joyminda Palokoa George (2019).
vectors.name: Communication infrastructure

vectors.Description: The location of wastewater treatment plant and related infrastructure on Kosrae. The original data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) (2013) as part of the "Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia" project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) extracted a subset from the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas. The features were updated using feedback from Kosrae Island Resource Management Authority (KIRMA).
vectors.name: Wastewater

vectors.Description: The locations of groundwater wells and springs on Kosrae. The original data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) (2013) as part of the "Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia" project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) extracted a subset from the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas. The features were updated using feedback from Kosrae Island Resource Management Authority (KIRMA).
vectors.name: Wells and springs

vectors.Description: The locations of drinking water treatment facilities on Kosrae. The original data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) (2013) as part of the "Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia" project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) extracted a subset from the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas. The features were updated using feedback from Kosrae Island Resource Management Authority (KIRMA).
vectors.name: Water treatment facilities

vectors.Description: The locations of storage tanks for fresh water on Kosrae. The original data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) (2013) as part of the "Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia" project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) extracted a subset from the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas. The features were updated using feedback from Kosrae Island Resource Management Authority (KIRMA).
vectors.name: Water tanks

vectors.Description: The locations of dams built to create small surface-water storage reservoirs on Kosrae. The original data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) (2013) as part of the "Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia" project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) extracted a subset from the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas. The features were updated using feedback from Kosrae Island Resource Management Authority (KIRMA).
vectors.name: Dams

vectors.Description: The locations of fuel tanks on Kosrae. The original data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) (2013) as part of the "Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia" project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) extracted a subset from the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas. The features were reviewed for accuracy and currentness.
vectors.name: Fuel farms

vectors.Description: The location of the power plant on Kosrae. The original data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) (2013) as part of the "Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia" project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) extracted a subset from the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas. The dataset was updated based on using KML file created by Joyminda Palokoa George (2019) specifically for this Digital Atlas.
vectors.name: Power plants

vectors.Description: The locations of the police stations on Kosrae. The original data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) (2013) as part of the "Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia" project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) extracted a subset from the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas. The dataset was updated based on KML files created by Joyminda Palokoa George (2019) specifically for this Digital Atlas.
vectors.name: Police stations

vectors.Description: The location of the fire station on Kosrae. The original data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) (2013) as part of the "Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia" project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) extracted a subset from the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas. The dataset was updated based on KML file created by Joyminda Palokoa George (2019) specifically for this Digital Atlas.
vectors.name: Fire stations

vectors.Description: The locations of churches and one mosque on Kosrae. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) from KML files created by Joyminda Palokoa George (2019) specifically for this Digital Atlas.
vectors.name: Places of worship

vectors.Description: The locations of schools and colleges on Kosrae. The original data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) (2013) as part of the "Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia" project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) extracted a subset from the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas. The dataset was updated based on KML files created by Joyminda Palokoa George (2019) specifically for this Digital Atlas.
vectors.name: Schools

vectors.Description: The locations of the hospital and community health centers on Kosrae. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) based on information from Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) (2013) and KML files created by Joyminda Palokoa George (2019) specifically for this Digital Atlas.
vectors.name: Hospitals and clinics

vectors.Description: The locations of key government offices (national, state, municipal, and Lelu town), as well as non-governmental organizations in Kosrae. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) from KML files created by Joyminda Palokoa George (2019) specifically for this Digital Atlas.
vectors.name: Government offices

vectors.Description: The locations of businesses on Kosrae. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) from KML files created by Joyminda Palokoa George (2019) specifically for this Digital Atlas.
vectors.name: Major businesses

vectors.Description: The footprints of all houses, buildings, and other human-made structures. The shapefile was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by manually digitizing polygons from 2015-2018 WorldView-2 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).
vectors.name: Footprints of houses and other buildings

vectors.Description: The locations of all houses, buildings, and other human-made structures. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by converting building footprints of houses and other buildings to point features. The buildings footprints were based on 2015-2018 WorldView-2 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).
vectors.name: Locations of houses and other buildings

vectors.Description: The international port and airport zones on Kosrae. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) based on 2015-2018 WorldView-2 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS). The dataset also includes the outline of the runway. The boundaries are not authoritative.
vectors.name: Port and airport zones

vectors.Description: The locations of dock, marina, port, and airport facilities on Kosrae. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019), based on 2015-2018 WorldView-2 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) and from KML files created by Joyminda Palokoa George (2019) specifically for this Digital Atlas.
vectors.name: Port and airport locations

vectors.Description: Rrecreational sites on Kosrae: prominent hiking locations, playfields, picnic sites, and others. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019), using KML files created specifically for this Digital Atlas by Joyminda Palokoa George (2019), as well as latitude-longitude coordinates provided by Kosrae Island Resource Management Authority (KIRMA).
vectors.name: Recreational sites

vectors.Description: Major bridges and causeways on Kosrae. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019), based on 2015-2018 WorldView-2 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).
vectors.name: Bridges and causeways

vectors.Description: The road network on Kosrae. It includes major roads as well as smaller paved and unpaved roads. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) based on a dataset by KIRMA and major adjustments made by John Paul Batarao (2019) to match 2018 WorldView-2 satellite imagery by Digital Globe provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).
vectors.name: Roads

vectors.Description: The percentage of households in each municipality on Kosrae that have a functioning Internet connection, and also provides information on the relative number of people who access the Internet. The attribute tables in the actual dataset contain more detailed information on the frequency of Internet use. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Internet usage

vectors.Description: The percentage of households in each municipality on Kosrae that have at least one telephone land line, and also provides information on the relative availability of cell phones. The attribute tables in the actual dataset also contain detailed information on the number of fixed and cellular phones, as well as radios and computers per household. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Households with telephones

vectors.Description: The percentage of households in each municipality on Kosrae that have at least one car, and also provides information on the total number of households with cars, boats with engine, and canoes and boats without engine. The attribute tables in the actual dataset also contain information about other vehicles (trucks, buses, motorbikes) and detailed information on specific numbers of each vehicle type per household. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Households with vehicles

vectors.Description: The percentage of households in each municipality on Kosrae that possess a sink and/or a refrigerator. The attribute tables in the actual dataset contain more detailed information on specific numbers of sinks and refrigerators, as well as other amenities including air conditioning units, generators, DVD/VCR players, and television sets with and without cable TV connection. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Households with selected appliances

vectors.Description: The percentage of households in each municipality on Kosrae that have complete kitchen facilities, and also provides information on energy sources for lighting and cooking. The attribute tables in the actual dataset contain more detailed information on specific types of energy sources. This dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Principal sources of energy for cooking and lighting

vectors.Description: The percentage of households in each municipality on Kosrae that have access to piped water, and also provides information on specific sources used to obtain fresh water for drinking and washing. The attribute tables in the actual dataset also contain information on toilet types and sewage disposal types in households. This dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Principal sources of water for drinking and washing

vectors.Description: The average number of rooms per household and the building materials used to make house roofs and walls in each municipality on Kosrae. The attribute tables in the actual dataset also contain information on specific building types, floor construction materials, age of buildings, and the number of persons per household and per room. This dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Housing structure

vectors.Description: The ownership status of households (owned free and clear of loan vs. owned with loan or rented) and land (owned vs. leased) in each municipality on Kosrae. The attribute tables in the actual dataset contain more detailed information on specific ownership types involved. This dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Housing tenure

vectors.Description: The average number of persons per household in each municipality on Kosrae, and also provides information on the percentage of family members vs. non-family members within the households. The attribute tables in the actual dataset contain more detailed information on types of relationships between household members, number of persons living in group quarters (school dormitories, correctional facilities, etc.), and average number of persons per family. This dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Household type

vectors.Description: The percentage of Kosraean residents aged 15 and above who are engaged in home production per municipality, and also provides information on what portions of home production are intended for own consumption, sale, or both. The attribute tables in the actual dataset also contain information on formal employment, including types of jobs, general areas of employment, and the type of employer. This dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Home production

vectors.Description: The percentage of Kosraean residents aged 15 and above who are in labor force per municipality, and also provides information on what portions of the labor force are formally employed, employed in home production, or unemployed. The attribute tables in the actual dataset contain more detailed information, including separate data for females and males. This dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Labor force

vectors.Description: The percentage of Kosraean residents with disabilities by municipality. The attribute tables in the actual data set contain more detailed information on specific disabilities (seeing, hearing, walking, remembering, etc.), number of disabilities, disability levels, and separate data for females and males. This dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Disabilities

vectors.Description: The percentage of Kosraean residents aged 25 and above who graduated high school and also provides information on the highest level of education attained by municipality. The attribute tables in the actual dataset contain information at a higher resolution (breakdown by individual grade levels) and separate data for females and males. This dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Educational attainment

vectors.Description: The percentage of Kosraean residents aged 3 and above enrolled in schools by municipality, and also provides information on the number of students attending different types of schools. The attribute tables in the actual dataset contain more detailed information, including separate data for females and males. This dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: School enrollment

vectors.Description: The literacy rate of Kosraean residents aged 5 and above by municipality, and also provides information on the first language spoken. The attribute tables in the actual dataset contain more detailed information on literacy levels in specific languages spoken as the first or second language for persons aged 5, as well as the specific languages predominantly spoken in households for persons aged 3 and above. This dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Literacy and language

vectors.Description: The religious affiliation of Kosraean residents aged 15 and above by municipality. The attribute tables in the actual dataset contain more detailed information on specific churches involved (or absence of religious belief) and on marital status. This dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Religion

vectors.Description: The percentage of ethnically Kosraean residents by municipality, and also provides information on the relative proportion of people identifying with one vs. more than one ethnicity. The attribute tables in the actual dataset contain more detailed information on the full range of specific ethnic identities involved. This dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2000) and the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Ethnicity

vectors.Description: The percentage of residents born outside of Kosrae by municipality. The attribute tables in the actual dataset contain very detailed information on specific places of birth and citizenship status. This dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Birthplace

vectors.Description: The population density of Kosrae by municipality, and also provides information on population growth in Kosrae from 1920 until 2010. The map was created using the same data layer as the map that shows population by age and sex. This geospatial dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Population density and growth

vectors.Description: The number of residents of Kosrae by municipality, and also provides information on sex and age distribution in the form of population pyramids for each municipality. The attribute tables in the actual dataset also contain information on median age and average annual population growth rate. This geospatial dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Population by age and sex

vectors.Description: The locations of all named geographic features on Kosrae that are contained within the Geographic Names Information System (GNIS). The GNIS is the official database that contains all standard toponyms in the U.S. and its territories and associated states. It was developed by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) in cooperation with the U.S. Board on Geographic Names (BGN) in order to standardize place names. Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) transferred this information to GIS format and shifted to match the most recent base layer and 2015-2018 WorldView-2 satellite imagery. Note that the actual names contained in the dataset are copied exactly as they are in GNIS and are not necessarily correct or aligned with Kosraean orthography.
vectors.name: Place names

vectors.Description: The locations of Tofol, the state capital of the Kosrae State, and Lelu, the island's main traditional center and historic capital. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019).
vectors.name: Capitals

vectors.Description: The lines separating the four municipalities of Kosrae plus the fifth municipality, Walung, before it was merged with Tafunsak in the 1980s. The original data, so-called Digital Line Graphs (DLSs), were created by U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) for the 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). The data were modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) to fit the most recent base layer. Note that boundaries shown in this map are not definite. This map does not constitute any sort of recommendation, claim, or endorsement.
vectors.name: Municipalities pre-1980s [lines]

vectors.Description: The four municipalities of Kosrae plus the fifth municipality, Walung, before it was merged with Tafunsak in the 1980s. The original data, so-called Digital Line Graphs (DLSs), were created by U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) for the 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). The data were modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) to fit the most recent base layer. Note that boundaries shown in this map are not definite. This map does not constitute any sort of recommendation, claim, or endorsement.
vectors.name: Municipalities pre-1980s [areas]

vectors.Description: The four municipalities of Kosrae. The original data, so-called Digital Line Graphs (DLSs), were created by U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) for the 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). The data were modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) to fit the most recent base layer. Note that boundaries shown in this map are not definite. This map does not constitute any sort of recommendation, claim, or endorsement.
vectors.name: Municipalities [lines]

vectors.Description: The four municipalities of Kosrae. The original data, so-called Digital Line Graphs (DLSs), were created by U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) for the 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). The data were modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) to fit the most recent base layer. Note that boundaries shown in this map are not definite. This map does not constitute any sort of recommendation, claim, or endorsement.
vectors.name: Municipalities [areas]

vectors.Description: The extent of agroforest on Kosrae, as mapped by the U.S. Forest Service (2007) through land cover classification based on 2004-2007 QuickBird satellite imagery by Digital Globe. The dataset was slightly modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) to better match 2015-2018 WorldView-2 satellite imagery.
vectors.name: Agroforests

vectors.Description: The extent of upland forest on Kosrae, as mapped by the U.S. Forest Service (2007) through land cover classification based on 2004-2007 QuickBird satellite imagery by Digital Globe. The dataset was slightly modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) to better match 2015-2018 WorldView-2 satellite imagery.
vectors.name: Upland forests

vectors.Description: The wetlands of Kosrae, as mapped by the U.S. Forest Service (2007) through land cover classification based on 2004-2007 QuickBird satellite imagery by Digital Globe. The dataset was slightly modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) to better match 2015-2018 WorldView-2 satellite imagery.
vectors.name: Wetlands

vectors.Description: The vegetation of Kosrae between 2004 and 2007. The dataset was developed from 2004-2007 QuickBird satellite imagery by Digital Globe through land cover classification carried out by U.S. Forest Service (2007). The dataset was slightly modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) to better match 2015-2018 WorldView-2 satellite imagery provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).
vectors.name: Vegetation (2005)

vectors.Description: The vegetation of Kosrae between 2004 and 2007. The dataset was developed from 2004-2007 QuickBird satellite imagery by Digital Globe through land cover classification carried out by U.S. Forest Service (2007). The dataset was slightly modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) to better match 2015-2018 WorldView-2 satellite imagery provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).
vectors.name: Vegetation (2004-2007)

vectors.Description: The average annual rainfall in inches on Kosrae. The original data were derived from weather records from 1971-2000 by Chris Daly and Mike Halbleib of the PRISM Group at Oregon State University (2006) and the U.S. National Park Service (2006). Data were converted to GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019).
vectors.name: Precipitation

vectors.Description: The location of the active weather observation sites on Kosrae. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using location information obtained from the National Weather Service office in Guam.
vectors.name: Weather stations

vectors.Description: Kosrae's principal watersheds (drainage basins) and their sub-watersheds. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019). All boundaries were delineated by Maria Kottermair (iREi) through hydrological modeling using a 10-meter Digital Elevation Model (DEM) by U.S. Geological Survey based on topography compiled in 1967. Note that apparently unnatural boundaries such as series of straight, parallel lines are artifacts of modeling and do not reflect reality.
vectors.name: Sub-watersheds

vectors.Description: The principal watersheds (drainage basins) on Kosrae. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019). Basin boundaries were delineated by Maria Kottermair (iREi) through hydrological modeling using a 10-meter Digital Elevation Model (DEM) by U.S. Geological Survey based on topography compiled in 1967. Note that basin boundaries shown are modeled and, as such, reflect the DEM and not necessarily actual situation on the ground. The watershed boundaries may differ from actual management units, especially as smaller basins were sometimes merged to a ‘principal’ watershed to avoid too many small remnant basins..
vectors.name: Principal watersheds

vectors.Description: The theoretical drainage pattern on Kosrae. The flow paths were delineated by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019). This was done by Maria Kottermair (iREi) through hydrological modeling using a 10-meter Digital Elevation Model (DEM) by U.S. Geological Survey based on topography compiled in 1967. Note that in very flat low-lying areas the data may indicate straight lines that are an artifact of the modeling process and do not reflect reality.
vectors.name: Flow paths

vectors.Description: The natural outflow locations on Kosrae, defined as points where streams and rivers discharge into the lagoon. The dataset was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by identifying the points where streams and rivers from 1:25,000-scale U.S. Geological Survey topographic maps (2001) intersect with the most recent shoreline of Kosrae.
vectors.name: Natural outflow points

vectors.Description: The rivers and streams on Kosrae as represented on the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). The dataset was extracted from the Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) from USGS and names from the Geographic Names Information System (GNIS) by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) and slightly modified to match the updated shoreline.
vectors.name: Streams and rivers [USGS version]

vectors.Description: The locations of mooring buoys around Kosrae. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) from information provided by Kosrae Island Resource Management Authority (KIRMA).
vectors.name: Mooring buoys

vectors.Description: The locations of popular surf breaks around Kosrae. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) from information provided by Kosrae Island Resource Management Authority (KIRMA).
vectors.name: Recreation

vectors.Description: TThe locations of principal passes in the barrier reef around Kosrae. This data layer was derived by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by slightly modifying data from U.S. Geological Survey 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). The place names shown on this map are copied from the source require thorough verification and correction of spellings to conform with Kosraean orthography.
vectors.name: Passes in the barrier reef

vectors.Description: This map classifies the reefs around Kosrae by their geomorphology. The dataset used here was created by the Millennium Coral Reef Mapping Project by the Institute for Marine Remote Sensing - University of South Florida (IMaRS-USF) and the Institut de Recherche Pour le Développement (IRD) (2005). Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) extracted a subset of the original dataset and formatted it for use in this atlas.
vectors.name: Reef geomorphology

vectors.Description: The extent of coral reefs around Kosrae. The data layer shown here is a subset of Kosrae base layer derived by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) from Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) of U.S. Geological Survey 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). The shoreline was partially updated and the coral reef features were slightly shifted and partially modified based on Worldview-2 satellite imagery from Digital Globe (2015-2018) provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).
vectors.name: Reef location

vectors.Description: The locations of prominent peaks on Kosrae. This data layer was developed by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by merging and slightly modifying data from U.S. Geological Survey's Geographic Names Information System (GNIS) and shapefiles provided by Kosrae Island Resource Management Authority (KIRMA). The place names shown on this map are copied from the two sources above and are not authoritative. They require thorough verification and correction of spellings to conform with Kosraean orthography.
vectors.name: Prominent peaks

vectors.Description: The general physiography of Kosrae. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) using a combination of 10-meter resolution Digital Elevation Model (DEM) (USGS, 1967) and the simple soil map of Kosrae (NRCS, 1981), and applying them to the base layer (iREi, 2019).
vectors.name: general physiography

vectors.Description: The basic soil types of Kosrae. The original dataset was created by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) (1983) as part of the soil survey of the Islands of Kosrae, Federated States of Micronesia at 1:10,000 scale. Soil map unit delineations were confirmed as accurate during a subsequent evaluation (1999). The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by extracting and formatting a subset of the Gridded Soil Survey Geographic (gSSURGO) Database for Federated States of Micronesia (2019) created by USDA-NRCS.
vectors.name: general land use

vectors.Description: The basic soil types of Kosrae. The original dataset was created by the U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS) (1983) as part of the soil survey of the Islands of Kosrae, Federated States of Micronesia at 1:10,000 scale. Soil map unit delineations were confirmed as accurate during a subsequent evaluation (1999). The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2019) by extracting and formatting a subset of the Gridded Soil Survey Geographic (gSSURGO) Database for Federated States of Micronesia (2019) created by USDA-NRCS.
vectors.name: Basic soil types

vectors.Description: The topography of Kosrae. It shows elevation contour lines at 50-meter intervals. Depicted in greyscale, the contour lines were derived by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) from a 10-meter resolution Digital Elevation Model (DEM) by U.S. Geological Survey based on topography compiled in 1967 and the shoreline dataset representing the zero contour line.
vectors.name: 50-m elevation contours

vectors.Description: The topography of Kosrae. It shows elevation contour lines at 10-meter intervals. Depicted in greyscale, the contour lines were derived by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) from a 10-meter resolution Digital Elevation Model (DEM) by U.S. Geological Survey based on topography compiled in 1967 and the shoreline dataset representing the zero contour line.
vectors.name: 10-m elevation contours

vectors.Description: The shoreline and the land area of Kosrae island, Lelu island, and smaller islands on the surrounding reef and in mangrove swamps. It actually contains two datasets: the shoreline itself and Kosrae base layer. Both were created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) based on Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) from U.S. Geological Survey 1:25,000-scale topographic maps. The shoreline and base layer were shifted and adjusted to follow current imagery better. In urban areas, the shoreline was updated using Worldview-2 satellite imagery from Digital Globe (2015-18) provided by U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS).
vectors.name: Shoreline

vectors.Description: The statues and monuments on Pohnpei. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), from original KMZ files created by Alex Zuccarelli for Pohnpei Eco-Adventure Map Guide Series (2013) appended by field verification.
vectors.name: Statues and monuments

vectors.Description: Some of the key historic sites and remains from the Spanish, German, and Japanese periods of Pohnpei's history. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), using KMZ files created by Alex Zuccarelli for Pohnpei Eco-Adventure Map Guide Series (2013).
vectors.name: Colonial period sites

vectors.Description: The ancient subdivisions of Pohnpei, as they existed at the time of Saudeleur dynasty. The boundaries are highly approximate and were digitized by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) from David L. Hanlon (1988), Upon a Stone Altar, University of Hawaii Press. Place name spellings are from Thomas Panholzer and Rufino Mauricio (2003), Place Names of Pohnpei Island, Bess Press.
vectors.name: Ancient subdivisions [Saudeleur times]

vectors.Description: The islets and buildings at Pohnpei's premier prehistoric site, the ancient Saudeleur capital at Nan Madol. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), using exclusively KMZ files created by Alex Zuccarelli for Pohnpei Eco-Adventure Map Guide Series (2013).
vectors.name: Nan Madol islets and buildings

vectors.Description: Some of the prominent prehistoric sites on Pohnpei. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), using exclusively KMZ files created by Alex Zuccarelli for Pohnpei Eco-Adventure Map Guide Series (2013).
vectors.name: Prominent prehistoric sites

vectors.Description: Some of the most significant cultural landmarks on Pohnpei. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), using exclusively KMZ files created by Alex Zuccarelli for Pohnpei Eco-Adventure Map Guide Series (2013).
vectors.name: Cultural landmarks

vectors.Description: The species-level conservation targets on Pohnpei. The geospatial data were created by The Nature Conservancy based on the results of the workshop convened in 2014 by The Nature Conservancy (TNC), Conservation Society of Pohnpei (CSP), and Pohnpei State Governor’s Office to discuss the design of Pohnpei’s Protected Areas Network (PAN). The original data set could not be located by TNC so a new one was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) by digitizing a hard copy map from the original workshop report.
vectors.name: Species-level conservation targets

vectors.Description: The Areas of Biological Significance (ABS) on Pohnpei. The data set was created by The Nature Conservancy. A subset to show only Pohnpei was created by the Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi). The polygons in the data are intended to capture those areas that represent the wide range of biodiversity features in the marine and terrestrial areas of FSM. They capture expert knowledge from the FSM Blueprint project. They are used to guide conservation planning and projects in FSM, and ultimately to help establish conservation areas.
vectors.name: Areas of biodiversity significance

vectors.Description: The proposed protected areas on Pohnpei. The data set was created by The Nature Conservancy based on the results of the workshop convened in 2014 by The Nature Conservancy (TNC), Conservation Society of Pohnpei (CSP), and Pohnpei State Governor’s Office to discuss the design of Pohnpei’s Protected Areas Network (PAN).
vectors.name: Proposed protected areas

vectors.Description: Elevation contour lines at 50-meter intervals. Depicted in grayscale, the contour lines were derived by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and University of Guam (UOG) from a 10-meter resolution Digital Elevation Model (DEM) created by U.S. Geological Survey based on topography compiled in 1975.
vectors.name: 50-m elevation contours

vectors.Description: The designated protected areas on and around Pohnpei. The data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) by merging information obtained from Pohnpei State Government, The Nature Conservancy, and KMZ files created by Alex Zuccarelli for Pohnpei Eco-Adventure Map Guide Series (2013). This GIS coverage may not be complete. Additional marine protected areas are referenced in legislation (e.g., http://www.fm/pohnpeiLeg/pending/PM_RD.doc) but may not have been delineated or formally implemented. Among sanctuaries that may exist in Pohnpei but are not yet included in these geospatial data are Sokehs Trochus Sanctuaries and Kepidau en Dauahk (Dawahk Pass) Marine Sanctuary.
vectors.name: Designated protected areas

vectors.Description: The location of a quarry on Pohnpei. The information was extracted by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) from Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) of U.S. Geological Survey 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001).
vectors.name: Quarries

vectors.Description: The locations of cemeteries on Pohnpei. The information was extracted by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) from Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) of U.S. Geological Survey 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001).
vectors.name: Cemeteries

vectors.Description: The location of the landfill on Pohnpei. The data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), based on 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery by Digital Globe.
vectors.name: Waste disposal

vectors.Description: The communication infrastructure on Pohnpei. The features shown include communication towers, wifi access points, and cell sites. The original data, so-called Digital Line Graphs (DLSs), were created by U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) for the 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). The dataset was updated by Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) (2014) and Island Research & Education Initiative (2017) based on information provided by FSM Telecommunications Corporation.
vectors.name: Communication infrastructure

vectors.Description: The location of wastewater treatment plant and related infrastructure on Pohnpei. The data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) as part of the 'Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia' project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014).
vectors.name: Wastewater

vectors.Description: The sewer lines on Pohnpei. The data set was created by Pohnpei State Government (2013).
vectors.name: Sewer lines

vectors.Description: The locations of groundwater wells on Pohnpei. The data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) as part of the 'Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia' project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014).
vectors.name: Wells

vectors.Description: The locations of drinking water treatment facilities on Pohnpei. The data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) as part of the 'Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia' project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014).
vectors.name: Water treatment

vectors.Description: The locations of storage tanks for fresh water on Pohnpei. The data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) as part of the 'Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia' project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014).
vectors.name: Water tanks

vectors.Description: The location of water supply lines on Pohnpei. The data set was created by Pohnpei Utilities Corporation (2017).
vectors.name: Water lines

vectors.Description: The locations of a surface-water storage reservoir on Pohnpei. The data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) as part of the 'Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia' project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014).
vectors.name: Water reservoir

vectors.Description: Several water intake structures on Pohnpei. The original data are from Pohnpei State Government. Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) shifted the features to coincide with the closest nearby river. This data set requires verification as accuracy and completeness levels are not known and attribute information is not available.
vectors.name: Water intake structures

vectors.Description: The locations of fuel tanks on Pohnpei. The data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) as part of the 'Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia' project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014).
vectors.name: Fuel storage

vectors.Description: The locations of power plants on Pohnpei. The data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) as part of the 'Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia' project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014).
vectors.name: Power plants

vectors.Description: The  locations of police stations on Pohnpei. The data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) as part of the 'Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia' project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014) and further improved (with additional points added) by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017).
vectors.name: Police stations

vectors.Description: The locations of fire stations on Pohnpei. The data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) as part of the 'Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia' project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014).
vectors.name: Fire stations

vectors.Description: The locations of churches on Pohnpei. The information was extracted by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) from Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) of U.S. Geological Survey 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001).
vectors.name: Churches

vectors.Description: The locations of schools and colleges on Pohnpei. The data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) as part of the '' Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia ''project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014) and further improved (with additional points added) by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017).
vectors.name: Schools

vectors.Description: The locations of hospitals, clinics, and dispensaries on Pohnpei. The data were developed by the Pacific Disaster Center (PDC) as part of the 'Geospatial Information Development and Application to Support Effective Decision Making in the Federated States of Micronesia project conducted in partnership with Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) and College of Micronesia (COM), with funding from NOAA - Coastal Storms Program. The data were incorporated into PDC's DisasterAWARE decision-support system (2014) and further improved (with additional points added) by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017).
vectors.name: Hospitals and clinics

vectors.Description: Office locations of key government entities (state, national, foreign). The data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), based on field verification and 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery by Digital Globe.
vectors.name: Government offices

vectors.Description: The footprints of key government offices (state, national, foreign) and other major buildings. The data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), based on field verification and 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery by Digital Globe.
vectors.name: Major buildings in Kolonia and Palikir

vectors.Description: The locations of businesses on Pohnpei. The information was extracted by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) from Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) of U.S. Geological Survey 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001).
vectors.name: Major businesses

vectors.Description: The footprints of key government offices (state, national, foreign) and other major buildings. The data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), based on field verification and 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery by Digital Globe.
vectors.name: Locations of houses and other buildings

vectors.Description: The international port and airport zones on Pohnpei. The data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) by extracting polygons from zoning information provided by Pohnpei State Government and verifying them based on 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery by Digital Globe. The dataset also includes the outline of the runway. The boundaries are not authoritative.
vectors.name: Port and airport zones

vectors.Description: The locations of the international port and airport on Pohnpei. The data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), based on 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery by Digital Globe.
vectors.name: Port and airport locations

vectors.Description: Hiking trails on Pohnpei. The data layer was formatted for GIS by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), using KMZ files created by Alex Zuccarelli for Pohnpei Eco-Adventure Map Guide Series (2013) and Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) created by U.S. Geological Survey for 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001).
vectors.name: Hiking trails

vectors.Description: Major bridges and causeways on Pohnpei. The data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), based on 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery by Digital Globe.
vectors.name: Bridges and causeways

vectors.Description: The road network on Pohnpei. It includes major roads as well as smaller paved and unpaved roads. The data set was originally created by U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) (2001) for Digital Line Graphs (DLGs) used to show information on 1:25,000-scale topographic maps. It has been modified to reflect changes and add street names of selected roads throughout the years and using various sources including Kolonia Town Government, U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) - Natural Resources Conservation Service (NRCS), and Pohnpei State Government - Department of Land and Natural Resources (2013). A major update was performed by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) to reflect changes based on 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery by Digital Globe. The attribute information (name and type of road) has not been updated recently.
vectors.name: Roads

vectors.Description: The percentage of households in each municipality on Pohnpei that have a functioning Internet connection, and also provides information on the relative number of people who access the Internet. The attribute tables in the actual data set contain more detailed information on the frequency of Internet use. The data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Internet usage

vectors.Description: The percentage of households in each municipality on Pohnpei that have at least one telephone land line, and also provides information on the relative availability of cell phones. The attribute tables in the actual data set also contain detailed information on the number of fixed and cellular phones, as well as radios and computers per household. The data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Households with telephones

vectors.Description: The percentage of households in each municipality on Pohnpei that have at least one car, and also provides information on the total number of households with cars, boats with engine, and canoes and boats without engine. The attribute tables in the actual data set also contain information about other vehicles (trucks, buses, motorbikes) and detailed information on specific numbers of each vehicle type per household. The data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Households with vehicles

vectors.Description: The percentage of households in each municipality on Pohnpei that possess a sink and/or a refrigerator. The attribute tables in the actual data set contain more detailed information on specific numbers of sinks and refrigerators, as well as other amenities including air conditioning units, generators, DVD/VCR players, and television sets with and without cable TV connection. The data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Households with selected appliances

vectors.Description: The percentage of households in each municipality on Pohnpei that have complete kitchen facilities, and also provides information on energy sources for lighting and cooking. The attribute tables in the actual data set contain more detailed information on specific types of energy sources. This data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Principal sources of energy for cooking and lighting

vectors.Description: The percentage of households in each municipality on Pohnpei that have access to piped water, and also provides information on specific sources used to obtain fresh water for drinking and washing. The attribute tables in the actual data set also contain information on toilet types and sewage disposal types in households. This data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Principal sources of water for drinking and washing

vectors.Description: The average number of rooms per household and the building materials used to make house roofs and walls in each municipality on Pohnpei. The attribute tables in the actual data set also contain information on specific building types, floor construction materials, age of buildings, and the number of persons per household and per room. This data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Housing structure

vectors.Description: The ownership status of households (owned free and clear of loan vs. owned with loan or rented) and land (owned vs. leased) in each municipality on Pohnpei. The attribute tables in the actual data set contain more detailed information on specific ownership types involved. This data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Housing tenure

vectors.Description: The average number of persons per household in each municipality on Pohnpei, and also provides information on the percentage of family members vs. non-family members within the households. The attribute tables in the actual data set contain more detailed information on types of relationships between household members, number of persons living in group quarters (school dormitories, correctional facilities, etc.), and average number of persons per family. This data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Household type

vectors.Description: The percentage of Pohnpeian residents aged 15 and above who are engaged in home production per municipality, and also provides information on what portions of home production are intended for own consumption, sale, or both. The attribute tables in the actual data set also contain information on formal employment, including types of jobs, general areas of employment, and the type of employer. This data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Home production

vectors.Description: The percentage of Pohnpeian residents aged 15 and above who are in labor force per municipality, and also provides information on what portions of the labor force are formally employed, employed in home production, or unemployed. The attribute tables in the actual data set contain more detailed information, including separate data for females and males. This data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Labor force

vectors.Description: The percentage of Pohnpeian residents with disabilities by municipality. The attribute tables in the actual data set contain more detailed information on specific disabilities (seeing, hearing, walking, remembering, etc.), number of disabilities, disability levels, and separate data for females and males. This data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Disabilities

vectors.Description: The percentage of Pohnpeian residents aged 25 and above who graduated high school and also provides information on the highest level of education attained by municipality. The attribute tables in the actual data set contain information at a higher resolution (breakdown by individual grade levels) and separate data for females and males. This data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Educational attainment

vectors.Description: Major bridges and causeways on Pohnpei. The data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017), based on 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery by Digital Globe.
vectors.name: Bridges and causeways

vectors.Description: The percentage of Pohnpeian residents aged 3 and above enrolled in schools by municipality, and also provides information on the number of students attending different types of schools. The attribute tables in the actual data set contain more detailed information, including separate data for females and males. This data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: School enrollment

vectors.Description: The literacy rate of Pohnpeian residents aged 5 and above by municipality, and also provides information on the first language spoken. The attribute tables in the actual data set contain more detailed information on literacy levels in specific languages spoken as the first or second language for persons aged 5, as well as the specific languages predominantly spoken in households for persons aged 3 and above. This data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Literacy and language

vectors.Description: The religious affiliation of Pohnpeian residents aged 15 and above by municipality. The attribute tables in the actual data set contain more detailed information on specific churches involved (or absence of religious belief) and on marital status. This data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Religion

vectors.Description: The percentage of ethnically Pohnpeian residents by municipality, and also provides information on the relative proportion of people identifying with one vs. more than one ethnicity. The attribute tables in the actual data set contain more detailed information on the full range of specific ethnic identities involved. This data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Ethnicity

vectors.Description: The percentage of residents born outside of Pohnpei by municipality. The attribute tables in the actual data set contain very detailed information on specific places of birth and citizenship status. This data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Birthplace

vectors.Description: The population density of Pohnpei by municipality, and also provides information on population growth in Pohnpei from 1920 until 2010. The map was created using the same data layer as the map that shows population by age and sex. This geospatial data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Population density and growth

vectors.Description: The number of residents of Pohnpei by municipality, and also provides information on sex and age distribution in the form of population pyramids for each municipality. The attribute tables in the actual data set also contain information on median age and average annual population growth rate. This geospatial data set was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) using information from the FSM census of population and housing (2010).
vectors.name: Population by age and sex

vectors.Description: The locations of all named geographic features on Pohnpei that are contained within the Geographic Names Information System (GNIS). The GNIS is the official database that contains all standard toponyms in the U.S. and its territories and associated states. It was developed by the U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) in cooperation with the U.S. Board on Geographic Names (BGN) in order to standardize place names. Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) transferred this information to GIS format and shifted to match the most recent base layer and 2016 WorldView-3 satellite imagery. Note that the actual names contained in the data set are copied exactly as they are in GNIS and are not necessarily correct or aligned with Pohnpeian orthography.
vectors.name: Place names

vectors.Description: The land parcels of Kolonia town. This geospatial data set was created by Department of Land and Natural Resources (ca. 2005) by digitizing parcels recorded by Public Lands.
vectors.name: Kolonia land parcels

vectors.Description: The  locations of Palikir, the national capital of the Federated States of Micronesia, and Kolonia, the state capital of Pohnpei State. The data layer was created by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017).
vectors.name: Capitals

vectors.Description: The  lines separating the five wehi of Pohnpei. Wehi are Pohnpei's traditional kingdoms. Wehi correspond to modern municipalities. The only exception is Kolonia, which is not a wehi but became a municipality in 1965 when it was separated from Nett. The original data, so-called Digital Line Graphs (DLSs), were created by U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) for the 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). It was modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) to fit the most recent base layer. Note that boundaries shown in this map are not definite. This map does not constitute any sort of recommendation, claim, or endorsement.
vectors.name: Wehi [lines]

vectors.Description: The five wehi of Pohnpei. Wehi are Pohnpei's traditional kingdoms. Wehi correspond to modern municipalities. The only exception is Kolonia, which is not a wehi but became a municipality in 1965 when it was separated from Nett. The original data layer, so-called Digital Line Graphs (DLSs), was created by U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) for the 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). It was modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) to fit the most recent base layer. Note that boundaries shown in this map are not definite. This map does not constitute any sort of recommendation, claim, or endorsement.
vectors.name: Wehi [areas]

vectors.Description: The lines separating the six municipalities of Pohnpei. The original data, so-called Digital Line Graphs (DLSs), were created by U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) for the 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). It was modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) to fit the most recent base layer. At the same time, iREi added the municipality of Kolonia, which was defined as the sum of Kolonia Town parcels recorded by Public Lands and digitized by Department of Land and Natural Resources ca. 2005. Those parcels were merged into one polygon and cut from Nett Municipality, of which Kolonia was a part of until 1965. Note that boundaries shown in this map are not definite. This map does not constitute any sort of recommendation, claim, or endorsement.
vectors.name: Municipalities [lines]

vectors.Description: The six municipalities of Pohnpei. The original data, so-called Digital Line Graphs (DLSs), were created by U.S. Geological Survey (USGS) for the 1:25,000-scale topographic maps (2001). The data were modified by Island Research & Education Initiative (iREi) (2017) to fit the most recent base layer.
